title: Linux unzip Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the unzip command in Linux to extract files from compressed ZIP archives, including password-protected ones.

meta.title: Linux unzip Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the unzip command in Linux to extract files from compressed ZIP archives, including password-protected ones.
meta.keywords: Linux, unzip, zip, compression, archiving, file extraction, password-protected

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the unzip Command

verify.name: Verify the unzip command syntax
verify.hint: The output of the `unzip -h` command should include the "Usage: unzip" line. Please check the output and try again.

steps.title: Extract Files from a Compressed ZIP Archive

verify.name: Verify the files are extracted
verify.hint: The `example` directory and the three text files (`file1.txt`, `file2.txt`, and `file3.txt`) should be present in the `~/project/example` directory after running the `unzip` command.

verify.name: Verify the password-protected file is extracted
verify.hint: The `protected` directory and the `protected_file.txt` file should be present in the `~/project/protected` directory after running the `unzip` command with the correct password.
